remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> object represents a sequence of glyphs from a single face of a single font at a single size, and with a single rendering style.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> contains font details such as glyph indices and individual glyph positions. In addition, <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> contains the original Unicode code points the run was generated from, character to glyph buffer offset mapping information, and per-character and per-glyph flags.
Each glyph in a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> defines metrics that specify how it aligns with other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs>. The following graphic defines the various typographic qualities of two different glyph characters.
![Diagraph of glyph measurements](~/add/media/glyph-example.png "Diagraph of glyph measurements") Various typographic qualities of two different glyph characters
**Freezable Features:** A GlyphRunDrawing is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object and therefore can be frozen to improve performance. For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
**Caution:** GlyphRunDrawing objects do not support partial trust execution. An application must have full trust permissions to use GlyphRunDrawing objects.
## Examples The following example uses a GlyphRunDrawing to draw the text "Hello World".
[!code-cs[DrawingMiscSnippets_snip#GlyphRunDrawingExampleInline](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/DrawingMiscSnippets_snip.misc_snippets/GlyphRunDrawingExample.cs#glyphrundrawingexampleinline)] [!code-xml[DrawingMiscSnippets_snip#GlyphRunDrawingExampleInline](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/DrawingMiscSnippets_snip.misc_snippets/GlyphRunExample.xaml#glyphrundrawingexampleinline)]
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> is a low-level object intended for use with fixed-format document presentation and print scenarios. A simpler way to draw text to the screen is to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>. For more information about <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>, see the [Introduction to the GlyphRun Object and Glyphs Element](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) overview.
